Key Match Events: Afghanistan bowler Fareed Ahmed and Pakistan batter Asif Ali nearly came to blows during their Asia Cup T20 clash.
Naseem Shah clobbered consecutive sixes off fast bowler Fazalhaq Farooqi in the final over to take Pakistan to 9-131 and the victory.
Naseem Shah clean bowled Afghanistan captain Mohammad Nabi for a golden duck.
Left-armer Fazalhaq Farooqi trapped Babar Azam leg before wicket for a golden duck and ended up with 3-34.
Leg-spinner Rashid Khan had Mohammad Rizwan lbw before Shadab Khan and Iftikhar Ahmed steadied the chase with a 42-run partnership.
Fareed Khan had Iftikhar Ahmed caught at deep midwicket and ended up with 3-31.
Shadab Khan claimed the key wicket of Najibullah Zadran.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan skipper Babar Azam mentioned it was a tense environment in the dressing room and expressed belief in Naseem Shah's batting abilities.
Afghanistan captain Mohammad Nabi reflected on the team's inability to control nerves and execute slower balls and yorkers in the final moments.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan's win ended India's slim chances to reach the Asia Cup final.
Fans were stunned by violence among the crowd after the match, with spectators hurling chairs at one another.
